hanzi-su-wiki:
仕

Значения

Служить, исполнять обязанности

Мнемоника

  • Человек 亻 в услужении у самурая 士.

  • Самурай 士 служит своему господину 亻.
purpleculture_pinyin:
shì
to serve as an official; an official; the two chess pieces in Chinese chess guarding the "general" or "king" 将
служить официальным лицом; официальный; две шахматные фигуры в китайских шахматах, охраняющие «генерала» или «короля» 将
rtega_mnemonic:
仕仕RS
X		work, serve
  • boy 亻 of a professional man 士
 働; 勤 役 侍 任 務; 酌

仕仕RSofficial, serve government, attend, doing
  • person 亻 educated professionally 士: official attending his duties
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 士 indicates the sound; 亻 (person) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
仕途 [ shì tú ]: official career (formal)
仕女 [ shì nǚ ]: court lady; palace maid; traditional painting of beautiful women
仕宦 [ shì huàn ]: (literary) to serve as an official
致仕 [ zhì shì ]: to retire from a government post (old)
兴都库仕 [ xīng dū kù shì ]: the Hindu Kush (mountain range)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 亻 [ rén ] man, person; people
    • 士 [ shì ] scholar, gentleman; soldier
heisig_story: Person . . . samurai. The key word means to wait on someone or serve them.
koohiiStory1: Back in the day, a person who stands beside a samurai is usually attending to them or working for them.
koohiiStory2: [+fuaburisu] Mr T attends to Tom Cruise in the Last Samurai, who is doing hara-kiri. Imagine Tom Cruise outside in the final scene, stabbing his knife into his stomach, while Mr T looks patiently on. "I pity da foo....no, really.".
jp_example_words:
給仕(きゅうじ): office boy (girl), page, waiter
仕上がり(しあがり): finish, end, completion
仕上げ(しあげ): end, finishing touches, being finished
仕上げる(しあげる): to finish up, to complete
仕入れる(しいれる): to lay in stock, to replenish stock, to procure
仕掛け(しかけ): device, trick, mechanism, gadget, (small) scale, half finished, commencement, set up, challenge
仕掛ける(しかける): to commence, to lay (mines), to set (traps), to wage (war), to challenge
仕切る(しきる): to partition, to divide, to mark off, to settle accounts, to toe the mark
仕組み(しくみ): devising, plan, plot, contrivance, construction, arrangement
仕立てる(したてる): to tailor, to make, to prepare, to train, to send (a messenger)
仕付ける(しつける): to be used to a job, to begin to do, to baste, to tack, to plant
仕舞(しまい): end, termination, informal (Noh play)
仕舞う(しまう): to finish, to close, to do something completely, to put away, to put an end to
仕様(しよう): way, method, resource, remedy, (technical) specification
仕える(つかえる): to serve, to work for
奉仕(ほうし): attendance, service
仕上がる(しあがる): be finished
仕方(しかた): method, way
仕事(しごと): work, occupation, employment
jp_readingExamples: 仕事 (しごと), 出仕 (しゅつし), 仕える (つか.える)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The leader samurai didn't become leader by sitting around not taking action. He got to where he is by doing.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine the leader samurai doing things. He's doing more than anyone else, no one can keep up with what he's doing.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: He was doing things with sheep (し). He is the leader of the sheep clan, and he was able to do more with sheep than anyone else. That's why he's the leader.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture the leader samurai doing lots of sheep things. He's shearing sheep. He's feeding sheep. He's doing everything you could possibly do, because he's the sheep samurai.

Ru_trainchinese: shì: (графема) быть чиновником, находиться на государственной службе
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the man (亻) with the samurai (士) attends to him
humanum_short_description_en:
The inscriptions from " person ", " shi " sound, " shi " is on the left, and " ren " is on the right. Bronze inscriptions are used as names of people or places, and the meaning is unknown.

"Shuowen" means learning politics, probation, "learning. From people to scholars." Xu Kai's "Biography of the Department" is the "sound of scholars." Duan Yucai's note: "Training an official is to be an official, this is the meaning of this. The ancient righteous eunuch trains an official, and the official training learns." Zhu Junsheng: "It is still a trial."
humanum_short_description:
金文從「人」，「士」聲，「士」在左，「人」在右。金文用作人名或地名，意義不詳。

　　《說文》表示學習政事，見習試用，「學也。从人从士。」徐鍇《繫傳》作「士聲」。段玉裁注：「訓仕爲入官，此今義也。古義宦訓仕，仕訓學。」朱駿聲：「猶今言試用也。」

仕字的基本解释

仕
shì
做官：出仕。仕宦。学而优则仕。仕途。仕女（a.宫女，贵族妇女；b.以社会上层妇女为题材的中国画。均亦作“士女”）。
审察：“弗问弗仕”。
古同“事”，事业。

仕字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shì］
［《廣韻》鉏里切，上止，崇。］
(1)为官；任职。
(2)引申为职位。
(3)审察。
(4)通“事”。谓从事于某种工作或事业。
(5)通“士”。古代四民之一。指以道艺、武勇谋求仕进的人。

仕字的英文翻译

◎ 仕
be an official

仕字的康熙字典解释

【子集中】【人字部】　仕； 康熙笔画：5； 页码：页92第07
【唐韻】【韻會】鉏里切【集韻】上史切，?音士。仕宦也。【禮·曲禮】四十曰强而仕。【禮運】仕于公曰臣，仕于家曰僕。　又官名。登仕郞。見【隋書·百官志】。將仕郞，見【韓愈·與于襄陽書】。　又察也。【詩·小雅】弗問弗仕，勿罔君子。【箋】不問而察之，則下民未罔其上矣。　又通事。【詩·大雅】武王豈不仕。【註】仕，事也。　又【韻補】叶牀舉切，音齟。【易林】伊伯致仕，去桀耕野。執順以傳，反和無咎。野音暑。咎音榘。

仕字的源字形

仕字的起名意思

：做官，出仕，仕宦，古同“事”，事业。

official
Basic explanation of words
official
shì
Be an official: go out of office. Official official. To learn and to be good is to be an official. Official career. Ladies (a. Palace ladies, aristocratic women; b. Chinese paintings based on women of the upper class in society. Both are also referred to as "gentlemen").
Examination: "Fu asked Fushi".
Gu Tong "things", career.
official
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［shì］
["Guangyun" 鉏里切, top stop, Chong. ]
(1) To be an official; hold office.
(2) Extended to position.
(3) Inspection.
(4) Through "things". It is engaged in a certain job or career.
(5) Through "Taxi". One of the Four Ancient People. Refers to a person who seeks career advancement by virtue of Taoism and Martial Arts.
official
English translation of words
◎ Shi
be an official
official
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Subset] [Human Character Department] 　仕; Kangxi Strokes: 5; Page Number: Page 92 Page 07
[Tang Yun] [Rhyme Association] 鉏里切 [Ji Yun] History cut,? Musician. Officials also. 【Li·Qu Li】Forty-forty means strong and official. [Li Yun] To serve as a minister is called a minister, and to serve as a servant is called a servant.　Also official name. Deng Shi Yun. See [Sui Shu·Baiguan Zhi]. Jiang Shi Yun, see [Han Yu·Yu Xiangyang Book].　Check again. 【Poetry·Xiaoya】Fu asked Fushi, don't be a gentleman. 【Jan】If you don’t ask, but you don’t ask, you don’t stop the people.　Tong Shi. 【Poetry·Daya】Why isn't King Wu an official? [Note] Shi, things are also.　[Rhyme Supplement] The leaf bed is lifted and cut, and the sound is tangled. [Yi Lin] Yibo is an official, go to Jie Gengye. Persevere in order to pass, oppose and blameless. Ye Yin Shu. Blame sound 榘.

~宦:一进 ~路 ~女 ~途 出~ 勒令致~

официальный
Зная слово.
Конгрен (イ), человек, стоящий в письменной форме печати; Конгши, общий термин для официальных лиц, означает лицо, которое является официальным лицом.
Первоначальный смысл - быть официальным.

shì

III собств.
Ши (фамилия)

仕

Значения

Служить, исполнять обязанности

Мнемоника

  • Человек 亻 в услужении у самурая 士.

  • Самурай 士 служит своему господину 亻.
Radicals: ｲ, 士  (leader, samurai)
Meaning Mnemonic
The leader samurai didn't become leader by sitting around not taking action. He got to where he is by doing.
Imagine the leader samurai doing things. He's doing more than anyone else, no one can keep up with what he's doing.
Reading Mnemonic
He was doing things with sheep (し). He is the leader of the sheep clan, and he was able to do more with sheep than anyone else. That's why he's the leader.
Picture the leader samurai doing lots of sheep things. He's shearing sheep. He's feeding sheep. He's doing everything you could possibly do, because he's the sheep samurai.
